name: Algebra & Functions
description: Surds, indices, quadratics, inequalities, simultaneous equations, proof by deduction and contradiction
commonMisconceptions: Squaring both sides of an inequality always preserves the direction
The discriminant b^2 - 4ac > 0 means exactly two roots (ignoring repeated roots when = 0)
sqrt(a + b) = sqrt(a) + sqrt(b)
x^0 = 0 instead of x^0 = 1
Proof by example is a valid form of mathematical proof

name: Polynomials
description: Factor theorem, algebraic division, partial fractions, binomial expansion
commonMisconceptions: The factor theorem says f(a) = 0 means (x + a) is a factor (should be (x - a))
Forgetting to check for improper fractions before decomposing into partial fractions
The binomial expansion of (1 + x)^n is valid for all x when n is not a positive integer
Ignoring the remainder when dividing polynomials

name: Trigonometry
description: Trig ratios, identities, equations, graphs, radians, arc length and sector area
commonMisconceptions: sin(A + B) = sin(A) + sin(B)
The inverse of sin is 1/sin rather than arcsin
Forgetting to find all solutions in the given range (missing quadrants)
Using degrees in formulas that require radians (arc length, sector area)
tan(90) = 0 instead of undefined

name: Exponentials & Logarithms
description: Laws of logarithms, exponential functions, natural logarithm, solving exponential equations
commonMisconceptions: log(a + b) = log(a) + log(b) — this is wrong; only log(ab) = log(a) + log(b)
ln(0) = 0 instead of being undefined
e is exactly 2.7 rather than an irrational constant approximately 2.71828
log_a(0) = 0 instead of being undefined
Confusing ln(x^2) with (ln x)^2

name: Differentiation
description: First principles, power rule, chain/product/quotient rules, tangents, normals, stationary points
commonMisconceptions: d/dx(x^n) = x^(n-1) — forgetting the coefficient n
The product rule is d/dx(uv) = (du/dx)(dv/dx) instead of u(dv/dx) + v(du/dx)
A stationary point where f''(x) = 0 must be a point of inflection
The normal has the same gradient as the tangent
Forgetting to use the chain rule for composite functions like sin(3x)

name: Integration
description: Reverse of differentiation, definite integrals, area under a curve, trapezium rule
commonMisconceptions: Forgetting the + c constant in indefinite integration
Integrating x^n gives x^(n+1) without dividing by (n+1)
Area below the x-axis is automatically positive when calculated by integration
The trapezium rule gives an exact answer rather than an approximation
Integrating 1/x gives ln|x| but forgetting the absolute value

name: Statistics
description: Data presentation, measures of central tendency and spread, probability, binomial distribution, hypothesis testing
commonMisconceptions: P(A and B) = P(A) x P(B) is always true — only for independent events
The significance level is the probability the null hypothesis is true
A result in the critical region 'proves' the alternative hypothesis
The mean of a binomial distribution is n x p + 1
Confusing one-tailed and two-tailed tests when determining the critical region
